newsArray.title: Arsene Wenger insists Arsenal's £105m outlay on Declan Rice is a 'good investment'
newsArray.description: Building a squad with a focus on youth was a hallmark of Wenger's 22-year stint at the Gunners, and he hailed the arrival of Rice at the club as a continuation of that philosophy.
newsArray.content: Arsene Wenger insists Arsenal's £105m outlay on Declan Rice is a 'good investment' as the Gunners legend laments that he 'had to cope with no money at all' during his time in charge Arsenal legend Arsene Wenger hailed the club's signing of Declan Rice Former West Ham star was unveiled as the club's record signing on Saturday Wenger reflected such funds were not available towards the end of his tenure By Adrian Bishop For Mailonline Updated: 14:08, 16 July 2023 e-mail View comments Arsene Wenger has revealed that he sees Arsenal 's club-record signing of Declan Rice as a good investment in the squads future. Following weeks of speculation, the former West Ham captain's move to the Emirates was finally confirmed on Saturday, with the £105m fee eclipsing the £100m Man City paid for Jack Grealish to make Rice the most expensive British footballer ever. After coming agonisingly close to a first Premier League title in nearly two decades last season, Mikel Arteta has been afforded a sizeable war chest to continue his side's progress in 2023-24. Along with the capture Rice, Arsenal have also signed Kai Havertz from Chelsea for £65m and Jurrien Timber from Ajax for £40m, with further additions expected before the end of the transfer window. Building a squad with a focus on youth was a hallmark of Wenger's 22-year stint at the Gunners, and he hailed the arrival of Rice at the club as a continuation of that philosophy. Arsene Wenger hailed Arsenal's club-record £105m signing of Declan Rice from West Ham The legendary Gunners boss called the move a 'good investment' and tipped the squad to win the Premier League 'I think it is a good investment,' Wenger told Eurosport . 'Overall, personally I think they have made good buys as they are players who are now mature, 23,24, and still young so can stay together for a few years. 'They will be under more pressure after last year, but they have learned a lot and they can show they can deal with that pressure now.' The signings of Rice, Timber and Havertz already rank among the ten highest transfer fees paid in the club's history, with a further four players on the list having signed with the club in the five years since Wegner's departure in 2018. Reflecting on the funds available to him towards the end of his time in charge, the 73-year-old admitted that he was forced to develop his squad utilising a different approach. Arsenal's last Premier League win came nearly two decades ago with Wenger at the helm 'I had to cope with no money at all, so you have to find a different way. 'Arsenal is now in a good financial situation and bought what they think will win the championship.' Arsenal's last Premier League triumph came during Wenger's tenure at the club and the Frenchman backed his former side to finally reclaim the title next season. 'I believe we will win the championship, it is as simple as that.' newsArray.title: Manchester City youngster Josh Adam is attracting interest from Lille and Club Brugge
newsArray.description: Josh Adam could become one of the next academy products to leave Manchester City with interest in him growing from clubs in France and Belgium.
newsArray.content: Manchester City youngster Josh Adam is attracting interest from Lille and Club Brugge, as Pep Guardiola's side continue to cash in on there lucrative academy Man City midfielder Josh Adam is attracting interest from France and Europe The 19-year-old will struggle to secure first team football if he stays at the Etihad Pep Guardiola's side made £50m from selling academy products last summer By Adrian Kajumba For Mailonline Updated: 08:33 EDT, 16 July 2023 e-mail View comments Josh Adam could become one of the next academy products to leave Manchester City with interest in him growing from clubs in France and Belgium. Lorient, who tried to sign attacking midfielder Adam in January, Lille and Club Brugge are all keen on signing the 19 year-old this summer. Scotland under-21 international Adam joined City from Celtic three years ago and is tipped for a bright future for club and country after impressing across Europe at youth level. However, with a congested pathway to first-team football at City Adam could move on in search of more opportunities. City’s youth team products have become an increasingly lucrative revenue stream for the club in more recent years. Man City midfielder Josh Adam is attracting interest from clubs in Belgium and France Last summer Gavin Bazunu, Aro Muric, Juan Larios, Romeo Lavia, Darko Gyabi and Sam Edozie all left City for a combined sum in excess of £50m. This week Southampton sealed the £15m signing of City midfield prospect Shea Charles, and goalkeeper James Trafford is set to join Burnley in a £19m deal after inspiring England’s under-21s to Euros glory. Pep Guardiola's side have also strengthened their side this summer, with Mateo Kovacic arriving from Chelsea for £25 million. They have lost Ilkay Gundogan to Barcelona on a free transfer, though, and doubts remain over Riyad Mahrez's future amid links with Saudi Arabia. City's title defence will get underway in just under a month's time, when they face club legend Vincent Kompany's Burnley side in August 11. Pep Guardiola's side made £50 million from selling academy products last season Share or comment on this article: Manchester City youngster Josh Adam is attracting interest from Lille and Club Brugge e-mail Add comment Comments 0 Share what you think No comments have so far been submitted. newsArray.title: Marcus Rashford parks his brand new £700,000 Rolls-Royce on double yellow lines in Cheshire
newsArray.description: Man United striker Marcus Rashford was spotted with his car parked on double yellow lines on Saturday, as he visited a jewellers in Chesire.
newsArray.content: Marcus Rashford parks his brand new £700,000 Rolls-Royce on double yellow lines in Cheshire, as the Man United striker gets out to sign autographs with teammate Tyrell Malacia Marcus Rashford has been spotted parked on double yellow lines on Cheshire He left his £700,000 Rolls-Royce to sign autographs and visit a jewellers The England striker was joined by Man United teammate Tyrell Malacia By Michael Rudling For Mailonline Updated: 13:32, 16 July 2023 e-mail View comments Man United striker Marcus Rashford was spotted with his car parked on double yellow lines on Saturday, as he visited a jewellers in Chesire. The 25-year-old was joined by teammate Tyrell Malacia in his brand new £700,000 Rolls-Royce for a 20-minute private shopping trip, for which the shutters remained down. Rashford, who wore a green tracksuit with white trainers, was also seen signing autographs for fans. One young supporter was even wearing a number 10 Man United shirt with the England striker's name on the back, and received a signature from his hero. It came after United's international players were pictured back in training for the first time, as they gear up for a pre-season tour of America. Marcus Rashford parked on double yellow lines in Cheshire on Saturday as he visited a jewellers He was joined by Man United teammate Tyrell Malacia in his £700,000 Rolls-Royce The 25-year-old striker signed an autograph for a young fan donning a Man United shirt The likes of Bruno Fernandes, Casemiro and Rashford were all pictured heading into Carrington on Saturday, and the squad seemed in a buoyant mood as they began to dust off the cobwebs ahead of next season. Those who did not take part in the post-season internationals have been back in training for over a week now, with their first game held last week as they beat Leeds 2-0 in Norway in their opening game of the summer. Non-internationals such as Mason Mount , Raphael Varane and Tom Heaton played in the game which saw youngsters Noam Emeran and Joe Hugill net in the second half to give Erik ten Hag's side the win. They will continue their campaign against Lyon on Wednesday before heading to the United States for games against Arsenal, Wrexham, Real Madrid and Borussia Dortmund. Rashford's last football came just over a month ago, when he played half an hour in England's 4-0 win over Malta and just under an hour of the 7-0 victory over North Macedonia, scoring on the stroke of half time. The England forward was seen smiling jubilantly on his return to training with fellow Red Devils attacker Anthony Elanga, who will be hoping to kick on next season and earn more first team opportunities. Rashford enjoyed the best goal soring season of his career in 2022-23, bagging 30 across all competitions as United came third in the league and one the League Cup. It came after Rashford returned to Carrington on Saturday as Manchester United geared up for the new season The striker painted a happy figure as he linked back up with the United squad Rashford was a key player for Erik ten Hag's side last season, scoring 30 goals as they won the League Cup and came third in the league He excelled on the left wing, but Erik ten Hag's failure to bring in a new striker could force him back into the middle again next season. The Red Devils were keen on Atalanta's Rasmus Hojlund but have been stunned by his £68 million price tag , while fellow targets Harry Kane and Victor Osimhen would have been even more expensive. If he does want to keen Rashford on the left, Ten Hag's only obvious option through the middle is the injury-prone Anthony Martial, although he did experiment with Jadon Sancho as a false nine in a recent friendly. United will still be hoping to find a new striker before their first Premier League game of the season against Wolves n August 14. newsArray.title: Transfer news LIVE: Onana 'travelling' for Man Utd medical, secret Klopp meeting, Kane twist
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Colin Millar)
newsArray.description: Arsenal fans can finally laud the signing of Declan Rice for a British record transfer fee of £105million, with West Ham set to use the funds to move for Harry Maguire
newsArray.content: The start of the Premier League campaign is now just one month away but there is still plenty of movement to come in the summer transfer window. On Saturday, Arsenal finally confirmed the signing of Declan Rice from West Ham for a new club record £105million fee. That followed c ompleting a deal for Ajax defender Jurrien Timber for £38.5 million, with Mikel Arteta's summer spending now beyond £200million. Manchester United are still pushing to sign Inter goalkeeper Andre Onana, and are also chasing Japanese stopper Zion Suzuki following the departure of David de Gea. Their search for a striker is proving tough however, with Atalanta's valuation of Rasmus Hojlund. Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson is still weighing up his future amid a huge offer to join the Saudi Pro League, with Fabinho also on the brink of a move to the Middle East. As a result, the Reds are set to move for Southampton star Romeo Lavia, whilst Chelsea are the front runners to sign Moises Caicedo from Brighton. Stay tuned for all the latest transfer news and gossip throughout the day... 13:51 KEY EVENT Done deal: Xavi Simons to rejoin PSG Xavi Simons is set to rejoin Paris Saint-Germain after a starring campaign at PSV Eindhoven, where he bagged 22 goals. 13:31 KEY EVENT Onana 'flying to England' to finalise Man Utd transfer Andre Onana is set to travel to England to complete his transfer to Manchester United after receiving a phone call from Erik ten Hag. Onana is set to sign a five-year contract after receiving assurances from Ten Hag that the deal was on track to being completed. It is believed a deal close to €50million (£43m), which includes around £5m in add-ons, is set to be agreed. The Dutch boss had always prioritised the signing of a new number one at Old Trafford this summer and the confirmation that David de Gea has left the club ensures that for the first time in 12 years, United will be lining up with a new first-choice goalkeeper next month. Read about Onana’s move to Man Utd 13:08 Liam Prenderville Spurs keen on Vlahovic Tottenham could move for Juventus striker Dusan Vlahovic if Harry Kane leaves the club. Kane continues to be linked with Bayern Munich while PSG are now also thought to be keen on the England skipper. The Mail reports Spurs have sounded out Vlahovic over a potential move to north London, and believe he would be an ideal replacement for Kane. 12:54 Fraser Watson West Ham chase Leicester star Harvey Barnes West Ham are interested in signing Leicester City forward Harvey Barnes, Sky Sports News is reporting. Newcastle United are also interested, but neither club have submitted a formal bid. Harvey Barnes ( Image: Getty Images ) 12:25 Fraser Watson Messi sells out Inter Miami stadium Lionel Messi will officially be unveiled as an Inter Miami player at the DRV PNK Stadium today. And tickets have sold out at the 18,000 seater arena as excitement hits fever pitch. 12:09 KEY EVENT Chelsea negotiate Caicedo fee Chelsea and Brighton are negotiating a fee for Moises Caicedo, according to Dello Sport . Brighton want a deal worth up to £100 million, with an initial £80 million and a potential £20 million in add ons. Chelsea however, do not want to exceed £90 million. 12:02 Fraser Watson PSG reject ex-Chelsea star Agent Jorge Mendes has offered Joao Felix to PSG, according to L'Equipe . However, the French club is focused on other business and have rejected the Portuguese star, who was on loan at Chelsea last season. 11:29 Fraser Watson Luton star Adebayo signs contract extension Luton Town forward Elijah Adebayo has signed a contract extension at the club. He scored 10 times for the Hatters last season, and told the club website: "It's wonderful to sign any contract but especially here. Because since I've come in, I've enjoyed my time here. There's a unique set of lads in the changing room." 11:01 Fraser Watson Mahrez agrees terms for Middle East move Riyad Mahrez has verbally agreed terms with Al-Ahli, according to reports. The deal is not completed but the Algerian international wants the move. The two clubs are yet to discuss a fee though. 10:32 Fraser Watson PSG to let Neymar leave PSG want to sell Neymar this summer, according to RMC Sport . However, they are not prepared to also los Kylian Mbappe. They still want to keeo the French star provided he opens talks on a contract extension. 10:03 Fraser Watson Liverpool legend sticks up for Henderson Ex-Liverpool striker Robbie Fowler has defended Jordan Henderson amid reports he's moving to play in Saudi Arabia. "I’m not going to condemn Jordan , Steven Gerrard or anyone else who has gone to work in Saudi Arabia , or is thinking of doing so," he wrote in his Mirror Football column. "Not because I’m taking the money too - that’s simply not true. As I’ve explained before, I have taken a job in the league below the Saudi Pro League because I am ambitious to become a manager, because I want to prove myself." Read the full column here 09:30 Fraser Watson Onana deal could be done today A deal to take Andre Onana from Inter Milan to Old Trafford could be completed today, accoring to alfredopedulla . The two clubs are still negotiating the exact nature of the fee, but Inter have now accepted Onana will leave and want to close the deal as soon as possible. The Cameroon keeper himself is waiting for the green light to fly to England. 09:02 Fraser Watson David de Gea heading back to Spain David de Gea could be heading back to Spain. Fichajes reports the former United keeper is being chased by Sevilla, amid speculation over their No 1 Yassine Bounou. He has been linked with both Paris Saint-Germain. 08:39 Fraser Watson Juventus after Barca star Kessie A new round of talks hasve been scheduled by Juventus in their bid to sign Franck Kessie from Barcelona, according to reports in Italy. The Serie A giants are keen on a deal, but Kessie is said to favour a move to the Premier League if he leaves the Nou Camp. MADRID, SPAIN - MARCH 02: Franck Kessie of FC Barcelona reacts during Semi Final Leg One - Copa Del Rey match between Real Madrid CF and FC Barcelona at Estadio Santiago Bernabeu on March 02, 2023 in Madrid, Spain. (Photo by Diego Souto/Quality Sport Images/Getty Images) ( Image: Diego Souto/Quality Sport Images/Getty Images) 08:24 Fraser Watson ICYMI: Rice vows to improve under Arteta Declan Rice has promised Arsenal fans he will get better after his move to the Emirates. On working with Mikel Arteta, he said: “I know he’s going to get the best out of me. I know I’ve got more levels to go up in my game, and I feel like he’s the manager to take me to those next levels. I’m really excited to be working with him.” 08:09 Fraser Watson West Ham set to move for Maguire West Ham are set to launch a move for Manchester United outcast Harry Maguire after selling captain Declan Rice to Arsenal . The Hammers are ready to take advantage of United's desire to move Maguire on, with the Daily Telegraph reporting they will target him as their next signing. 07:36 Fraser Watson Mane future in doubt after Tuchel blast Saido Mane's future at Bayern Munich appears up in the air after words from boss Thomas Tuchel. "He fell short of expectations," he told reporters. "The competitive situation is extremely high, the starting position is not easy for him. The player knows that too, he knows my opinion and the opinion of the club." 07:14 Fraser Watson Bayern Munich chief's Harry Kane claim Harry Kane is ready to leave Tottenham , according to Bayern Munich's honourary president has claimed. "So far, Harry has made it very clear in all talks that his decision is there. And if it stays, then we'll get him," said Uli Hoeness. "He now has another opportunity to come to a top club in Europe." Read the full story here. 06:18 Fraser Watson ICYMI: Declan Rice breaks British transfer record It was West Ham, not Arsenal, who announced Declan Rice had left the club on Saturday morning for a British transfer record of £105 million. He's since addressed West Ham fans, and lauded Mikel Arteta as the manager to take him "to the next level." Read the full story here. 06:10 KEY EVENT Lionel Messi completes move to Inter Miami A huge moment overnight for Lionel Messi, and football in America. 05:55 Fraser Watson Good morning Welcome back as we bring you all the latest transfer news! 23:05 Tom Blow Goodnight! That's all we've got time for this evening! Please join us again on Sunday morning for more transfer news and gossip. 22:36 Tom Hopkinson Sheff Utd want Shelvey Sheffield United are considering a move for out-of-favour Nottingham Forest midfielder Jonjo Shelvey. The former Liverpool and Newcastle player only moved to the City Ground six months ago but he has been left out of the club’s pre-season trining camp and Steve Cooper is now willing to let him leave. Shelvey wasn’t named in Forest’s last seven squads of last season after reacting angrily to being named on the bench against Liverpool. And the Blades are exploring the ex-England international’s availability as they look to strengthen their squad following their return to the Premier League. Boss Paul Heckingbottom is working to a tight budget and Shelvey would not break the bank. But he also has vast experience of the top flight and would undoubtedly strengthen the Brammall Lane squad. ( Image: PA) 22:00 Jacob Leeks Wright's role in Rice transfer Arsenal legend Ian Wright has joked he played a key role in convincing Declan Rice to join the Gunners. Rice completed a £105million transfer to the Gunners on Saturday, bringing an end to a long-running saga. At one point in the summer, it looked as if Manchester City had pulled into pole position in the race to sign the England international. But Arsenal were able to fight off that interest from their Premier League title rivals and secure Mikel Arteta's top target. And it turns out that Wright, who won the top-flight with the Gunners, played an important role in turning Rice's head towards Arteta's side. Click here to read more... 21:23 Colin Millar De Jong swap deal Barcelona have reactivated their interest in signing Bernardo Silva – with speculative suggestions that Frenkie de Jong may be offered to Pep Guardiola’s side to help facilitate the deal. Portugal international Silva has been on Barca’s wanted list for over a year with boss Xavi Hernandez confirming they wanted a deal last summer, which did not come to fruition. Silva has since become a key transfer target for PSG, who are looking for a player of that profile to replace Lionel Messi. City boss Guardiola has repeatedly refused to sanction Silva’s exit despite the player’s keenness for pastures new. The playmaker played a pivotal role in the club’s successes last campaign but he has made no secret internally that he was open to a move away from the Etihad. Click here to read more... 20:44 KEY EVENT Ramsey's new club Aaron Ramsey has signed a two-year contract with Cardiff City. The Wales captain, 32, joins the Championship club after leaving Nice. ( Image: PA) 20:19 Kieran King Bayern after Alvarez Bayern Munich are eyeing up a move for Manchester City forward Julian Alvarez as an alternative if they fail to sign Tottenham's Harry Kane this summer. Kane is Bayern's priority transfer target but there is a growing feeling that the England international could stay at Spurs beyond the end of the window. Bayern chief executive Jan-Christian Dreesen met with Daniel Levy for breakfast in London on Thursday as Kane's future was once again put into question. Click here to read more... 20:18 Tom Blow Arsenal ignore Rice concerns Manchester United decided against bidding for Declan Rice two years ago because their recruitment team weren't convinced by him. Arsenal completed the signing of Rice, 24, from West Ham in a £105million deal on Saturday afternoon. The Englishman has become the most expensive British footballer of all time and has signed a five-year deal with the Gunners, with the option of a further year. Rice became a transfer target for United when Ole Gunnar Solskjaer was in charge. It's believed the Norwegian, who has since been succeeded by Erik ten Hag, was interested in signing Rice after he helped England reach the final of Euro 2020 in July 2021. Click here to read more... 19:22 Tom Blow Messi joins Inter Miami Lionel Messi has officially joined Inter Miami... 18:54 Tom Blow Wolves after Scott Wolves will make a bid in excess of £20million for Bristol City midfielder Alex Scott, according to The Athletic . Scott, 19, has already played 83 Championship games for Bristol City. He was recently named as the Championship's Young Player of the Season.

newsArray.title: Sunday sport: Kerry and Derry to face off in All-Ireland semi-final
creator: BreakingNews.ie
newsArray.description: Kerry are defending the Sam Maguire Cup, while Derry are attempting to reach their first final in 30 years
newsArray.content: GAA Kerry and Derry meet in the second All Ireland senior football championship semi-final today. Throw in at Croke Park is at 4pm. Kerry are defending the Sam Maguire Cup, while Derry are attempting to reach their first final in 30 years. Dublin await the winners in the decider. Advertisement They finally pulled away from Monaghan to win by seven points yesterday. The curtain raiser at Croke Park today is the Junior All-Ireland final between New York and Kilkenny. It begins at 1.30pm. The ladies footballers of Donegal and Dublin contest the concluding All Ireland quarter-final this afternoon. There is a 2pm start time in Ballybofey. Mayo, Cork and Kerry are already in the last four, with Meath having lost their All Ireland title following a four-point defeat to Kerry yesterday. Advertisement Golf Rory McIlroy has work to do to win the Scottish Open at the Renaissance Club. He is 1 over par for his final round through 12 holes and 12 under for the tournament. McIlroy is two shots behind leader Robert MacIntyre of Scotland. Advertisement He is 6 under for his round with three holes to play and 14 under overall. Shane Lowry is in a tie for 11th place on 8 under par. Tom McKibbin is 4 under par and Padraig Harrington is 3 under. Tennis Serbia's Novak Djokovic and Spain's Carlos Alcaraz go head-to-head in the Wimbledon men's singles final in London this afternoon. Djokovic is attempting to win his 8th crown at the All England Club - while top seed Alcaraz is bidding for his first major on grass, 2pm is the start time. If Djokovic wins it will be 24 Grand Slam career titles. X

newsArray.title: Chelsea still in the race for Liverpool transfer target as they also make progress on another deal
creator: Mark Brus
newsArray.description: Chelsea are reportedly getting closer to an agreement on the transfer of Brighton midfielder Moises Caicedo whilst also still being in the race for Southampton wonderkid Romeo Lavia.The Blues will no doubt hope to strengthen in midfield this summer after losing both N’Golo Kante and Mateo Kovacic, while Jorginho was another key figure to leave […] The post Chelsea still in the race for Liverpool transfer target as they also make progress on another deal appeared first on CaughtOffside.
newsArray.content: The Blues will no doubt hope to strengthen in midfield this summer after losing both N’Golo Kante and Mateo Kovacic, while Jorginho was another key figure to leave the club back in January. Caicedo seems to be the priority but Fabrizio Romano has made it clear in his video below that Chelsea are also still there for Lavia, alongside Liverpool, while Arsenal could also be one to watch for the Belgian starlet in case they manage to sell Thomas Partey to a club from Saudi Arabia… Caicedo looks ideal for CFC, but if they could land Lavia as well, that would be another significant investment that could give the club some of the finest young midfielders in world football after they already brought in Enzo Fernandez back in January. Liverpool, however, will also surely want to ensure they can win the race for a talent like Lavia, whose presence could be crucial if the Reds end up losing the likes of Jordan Henderson and Fabinho this summer.

newsArray.title: Andre Onana 'flying to England' to finalise Man Utd transfer after Erik ten Hag call
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Colin Millar)
newsArray.description: Manchester United are close to completing the deal to sign goalkeeper Andre Onana from Inter as they make their second signing of the summer after Mason Mount's transfer
newsArray.content: Andre Onana is set to travel to England to complete his transfer to Manchester United after receiving a phone call from Erik ten Hag. Onana is set to sign a five-year contract after receiving assurances from Ten Hag that the deal was on track to being completed. It is believed a deal close to €50million (£43m), which includes around £5m in add-ons, is set to be agreed. The Dutch boss had always prioritised the signing of a new number one at Old Trafford this summer and the confirmation that David de Gea has left the club ensures that for the first time in 12 years, United will be lining up with a new first-choice goalkeeper next month. Erik ten Hag handed goalkeeper dilemma as Man Utd warned club "cannot wait forever" Harry Kane's Man Utd preference, secret transfer meeting and PSG hijack attempt Onana has already explained the specifics of his style of play that will benefit United, which will allow United to play with a higher back-line and to dominate more territory, while their possession should also increase as the Cameroonian is comfortable with playing out from the back. Sport Witness have cited reports in the Italian press from Gazzetta dello Sport and Corriere dello Sport claiming that Onana was given reassurances from Ten Hag that a deal was on track with the two clubs continuing to negotiate the finer details to clinch the move. It adds that the former Ajax star is planning to travel to Manchester on Sunday or Monday to undergo medical tests and seal the move. That would allow him to fly out with United on their pre-season tour, which starts next week. Ten Hag and Onana worked together for five years at Ajax ( Image: ISABELLA BONOTTO/AFP via Getty Images) Have Your Say! Will Onana prove to be a transformative signing for Man Utd ? Tell us what you think here. Negotiations had dragged on with the two clubs thought to be moderate valuations apart in the move, with both now set to cede some ground in order to process the deal. Inter are equally keen to complete the deal promptly to allow them to invest in other targets. Ten Hag has driven United’s transfer pursuit of Onana, over that of Porto shot-stopper Diogo Costa or David Raya of Brentford. He is aware of his strengths and weaknesses but is convinced the Inter goalkeeper is his man at Old Trafford. United completing the signing of Onana will allow them to move onto other targets, most notably Atalanta striker Rasmus Hojlund. It will also speed up the expected departure of Dean Henderson, who Nottingham Forest want to sign on a permanent deal with a possible fee of £30million.

newsArray.title: New Tiger in town for Open as Christensen qualifies in Woods’ absence
newsArray.description: Christensen was the only amateur to make it through final qualifying across four venues.
newsArray.content: Tiger Christensen came through final qualifying at West Lancashire Golf Club in Crosby, near Liverpool, earlier this month to book his major debut. But the United States-based 19-year-old accepts the similarities end with sharing the same name, country of residence and preference for an orange-and-black striped animal driver headcover. 🇩🇪Tiger Christensen (5/5) — The Open (@TheOpen) “He’s a pretty big inspiration. To me he’s the greatest of all time,” said the Arizona University student “I think it’s really special what he’s done for the game, changed the entire game and made it more popular, and his achievements are just unbelievable. “It’s something you could look up to.” Referring to how he got his name he added: “It’s not only named after Tiger Woods – my dad has a very good friend who’s a retired boxer and his ring name was Tiger so it’s 50/50.” “For me it’s never been (a burden) because it’s just my birth name. I’m glad to be called Tiger. “I understand everything I’m ever going to do they are going to compare me to him straightaway but at the end of the day it’s a different time, I don’t have any connection to him. It’s just a name.” “I played a lot of football when I was younger and I always wanted to be a football pro until I was about 10 and then I started playing US kids tournaments and that is when I transitioned to wanting to become a golf professional,” added the Hamburg-born golfer, whose world ranking is above 3,700. Christensen was the only amateur to make it through final qualifying across four venues, only three days after almost securing a place via the European Amateur Championship in Estonia. A month earlier the teenager made his DP World Tour debut with an appearance in the Porsche European Open held in the city of his birth, although rounds of 80 and 79 saw him miss the cut by some distance on 13 over. “I cope with pressure pretty good, although at the DP World Tour event there was a new pressure I hadn’t had in playing with spectators,” he said of his imminent Open appearance. “Usually in amateur events only the final couple of groups, if you are playing well, get spectators but I think the DP World Tour event really helped me going into the Open. Tiger Watch 🐅👀 Young German Amateur Tiger Christensen is tied for 4th after a 68 this morning. Live Scoring ⬇️ — West Lancs Golf Club (@WestLancsGC) “I’ve now had those couple of crowd experiences, the seriousness of everyone around the tournament and how professional it is, so I think that will help me a lot. “I don’t want to sound cocky but I was pretty certain of qualifying. I played the US Open qualifying and fell just short. I felt it wasn’t far away. “It’s going to be a great experience. I’m going to go with zero expectations and take it all in. “But my final goal, which is supported by smaller goals, is to win as many majors as I can.”

newsArray.title: OM : la patte Marcelino jugée par les Nîmois
newsArray.description: L'entraîneur de Nîmes, Frédéric Bompard, est revenu sur le match face à l’OM. Il a décrit son adversaire du jour, Marcelino.
newsArray.content: Hier soir, l’OM s’est imposé face au Nîmes Olympique grâce à un doublé de Vitinha pour le premier match de la pré-saison. La première de Marcelino en tant qu’entraîneur olympien est réussite et beaucoup de Marseillais ont eu du temps de jeu. L’adversaire du jour a pu commenter son nouveau style de jeu imposé par le coach espagnol. Après la rencontre, Frédéric Bompard, anciennement adjoint à l’OM et aujourd’hui coach à Nîmes s’est entretenu avec La Provence pour parler de la mise en place de Marcelino. « Le jeu est différent de celui de la saison dernière. L'an dernier, ça pressait très haut. Même s'ils sont quand même allés nous chercher, ils sont venus nous presser. Certains joueurs ont encore ce genre d'automatismes », a d’abord commenté l’entraîneur de l’équipe de National. « Il y a peut-être un peu moins de jeu vers l'avant, beaucoup plus de jeu entre les lignes. On est plus dans le “tiki taka“ que ça ne l'était la saison dernière. Avec Tudor, c'était beaucoup plus du jeu vers l'avant à la récupération, du football direct. C'est ce qui change un peu. Après, ça reste qu'un match, il va falloir attendre encore un peu », a-t-il reconnu pour le quotidien régional. Frédéric Bompard a ensuite été interrogé sur le système utilisé par Marcelino. « Ce n’est n'est pas le même. L'année dernière, ça jouait à trois, là c'est à quatre. Hier, ils ont joué en 4-2-3-1, ils ont changé les joueurs à la mi-temps, comme nous d'ailleurs. Ce ne sera pas du tout le même OM que celui de la saison dernière, ça c'est sûr. J'ai bien aimé mon échange avec Marcelino, j'aime bien le personnage, le fait de discuter comme ça, ça m'a bien plu », a conclu l’entraîneur des crocos. Le piqué de @9Vitinha lors de #OMNO 🇵🇹💫 🎥 Le 𝗿𝗲́𝘀𝘂𝗺𝗲́ 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲𝘁 👉 https://t.co/RPPqQrGEyU pic.twitter.com/OyGLa5alan L'entraîneur de Nîmes, Frédéric Bompard, est revenu sur le match face à l’OM. Il a décrit son adversaire du jour, Marcelino. "J'ai bien aimé mon échange avec Marcelino, j'aime bien le personnage, le fait de discuter comme ça, ça m'a bien plu".

newsArray.title: ‘Harry Kane has clearly signalled to join Bayern Munich,’ says Hoeness
newsArray.description: The German champion is said to be intent on securing the signing of England’s record scorer, whose contract with Spurs runs out in 2024.
newsArray.content: Bayern Munich’s honorary president Uli Hoeness has expressed confidence that England captain Harry Kane will join the German giants from Tottenham Hotspur. Kane “has clearly signalled in all conversations that his decision (to join Bayern this summer) has been taken and if he sticks to that, then we’ll get him because Tottenham will have to give way”, Hoeness said. It has been reported that Bayern has agreed on personal terms with Kane, but an initial 70-million-euro ($76-million) bid was rejected by Spurs who are said to be demanding at least 100 million euros to part with their talismanic striker who has been included in the London club’s squad for their pre-season Asia-Pacific tour. The German champion is said to be intent on securing the signing of England’s record scorer, whose contract with Spurs runs out in 2024. Kane’s camp is believed to have approved the move, but Bayern needs an agreement on a transfer fee with Tottenham to seal the transfer. Hoeness said Kane “wants to play in an international competition and Tottenham are not qualified next season” for Europe “unlike our club”. The striker “now has the chance to come play for one of the best clubs in Europe”, added Hoeness, a member of a Bayern committee overseeing this summer’s recruitment alongside Karl-Heinz Rummenigge, Jan-Christian Dreesen and coach Thomas Tuchel. Hoeness admitted that negotiating with Spurs president Daniel Levy was not easy. Levy, he said, is “intelligent and we first have to get him to a stage where he will figure out an amount” for the transfer. “He is trying to buy time, he is a seasoned professional, I appreciate him a lot. But on the other hand, we weren’t born yesterday.” Comments Related stories Related Topics

newsArray.title: Arsene Wenger insists Arsenal's £105m outlay on Declan Rice is a 'good investment'
newsArray.description: Building a squad with a focus on youth was a hallmark of Wenger's 22-year stint at the Gunners, and he hailed the arrival of Rice at the club as a continuation of that philosophy.
newsArray.content: Arsene Wenger insists Arsenal's £105m outlay on Declan Rice is a 'good investment' as the Gunners legend laments that he 'had to cope with no money at all' during his time in charge Arsenal legend Arsene Wenger hailed the club's signing of Declan Rice Former West Ham star was unveiled as the club's record signing on Saturday Wenger reflected such funds were not available towards the end of his tenure By Adrian Bishop For Mailonline Updated: 14:08, 16 July 2023 e-mail View comments Arsene Wenger has revealed that he sees Arsenal 's club-record signing of Declan Rice as a good investment in the squads future. Following weeks of speculation, the former West Ham captain's move to the Emirates was finally confirmed on Saturday, with the £105m fee eclipsing the £100m Man City paid for Jack Grealish to make Rice the most expensive British footballer ever. After coming agonisingly close to a first Premier League title in nearly two decades last season, Mikel Arteta has been afforded a sizeable war chest to continue his side's progress in 2023-24. Along with the capture Rice, Arsenal have also signed Kai Havertz from Chelsea for £65m and Jurrien Timber from Ajax for £40m, with further additions expected before the end of the transfer window. Building a squad with a focus on youth was a hallmark of Wenger's 22-year stint at the Gunners, and he hailed the arrival of Rice at the club as a continuation of that philosophy. Arsene Wenger hailed Arsenal's club-record £105m signing of Declan Rice from West Ham The legendary Gunners boss called the move a 'good investment' and tipped the squad to win the Premier League 'I think it is a good investment,' Wenger told Eurosport . 'Overall, personally I think they have made good buys as they are players who are now mature, 23,24, and still young so can stay together for a few years. 'They will be under more pressure after last year, but they have learned a lot and they can show they can deal with that pressure now.' The signings of Rice, Timber and Havertz already rank among the ten highest transfer fees paid in the club's history, with a further four players on the list having signed with the club in the five years since Wegner's departure in 2018. Reflecting on the funds available to him towards the end of his time in charge, the 73-year-old admitted that he was forced to develop his squad utilising a different approach. Arsenal's last Premier League win came nearly two decades ago with Wenger at the helm 'I had to cope with no money at all, so you have to find a different way. 'Arsenal is now in a good financial situation and bought what they think will win the championship.' Arsenal's last Premier League triumph came during Wenger's tenure at the club and the Frenchman backed his former side to finally reclaim the title next season. 'I believe we will win the championship, it is as simple as that.' newsArray.title: Manchester City youngster Josh Adam is attracting interest from Lille and Club Brugge
newsArray.description: Josh Adam could become one of the next academy products to leave Manchester City with interest in him growing from clubs in France and Belgium.
newsArray.content: Manchester City youngster Josh Adam is attracting interest from Lille and Club Brugge, as Pep Guardiola's side continue to cash in on there lucrative academy Man City midfielder Josh Adam is attracting interest from France and Europe The 19-year-old will struggle to secure first team football if he stays at the Etihad Pep Guardiola's side made £50m from selling academy products last summer By Adrian Kajumba For Mailonline Updated: 08:33 EDT, 16 July 2023 e-mail View comments Josh Adam could become one of the next academy products to leave Manchester City with interest in him growing from clubs in France and Belgium. Lorient, who tried to sign attacking midfielder Adam in January, Lille and Club Brugge are all keen on signing the 19 year-old this summer. Scotland under-21 international Adam joined City from Celtic three years ago and is tipped for a bright future for club and country after impressing across Europe at youth level. However, with a congested pathway to first-team football at City Adam could move on in search of more opportunities. City’s youth team products have become an increasingly lucrative revenue stream for the club in more recent years. Man City midfielder Josh Adam is attracting interest from clubs in Belgium and France Last summer Gavin Bazunu, Aro Muric, Juan Larios, Romeo Lavia, Darko Gyabi and Sam Edozie all left City for a combined sum in excess of £50m. This week Southampton sealed the £15m signing of City midfield prospect Shea Charles, and goalkeeper James Trafford is set to join Burnley in a £19m deal after inspiring England’s under-21s to Euros glory. Pep Guardiola's side have also strengthened their side this summer, with Mateo Kovacic arriving from Chelsea for £25 million. They have lost Ilkay Gundogan to Barcelona on a free transfer, though, and doubts remain over Riyad Mahrez's future amid links with Saudi Arabia. City's title defence will get underway in just under a month's time, when they face club legend Vincent Kompany's Burnley side in August 11. Pep Guardiola's side made £50 million from selling academy products last season Share or comment on this article: Manchester City youngster Josh Adam is attracting interest from Lille and Club Brugge e-mail Add comment Comments 0 Share what you think No comments have so far been submitted. newsArray.title: Marcus Rashford parks his brand new £700,000 Rolls-Royce on double yellow lines in Cheshire
newsArray.description: Man United striker Marcus Rashford was spotted with his car parked on double yellow lines on Saturday, as he visited a jewellers in Chesire.
newsArray.content: Marcus Rashford parks his brand new £700,000 Rolls-Royce on double yellow lines in Cheshire, as the Man United striker gets out to sign autographs with teammate Tyrell Malacia Marcus Rashford has been spotted parked on double yellow lines on Cheshire He left his £700,000 Rolls-Royce to sign autographs and visit a jewellers The England striker was joined by Man United teammate Tyrell Malacia By Michael Rudling For Mailonline Updated: 13:32, 16 July 2023 e-mail View comments Man United striker Marcus Rashford was spotted with his car parked on double yellow lines on Saturday, as he visited a jewellers in Chesire. The 25-year-old was joined by teammate Tyrell Malacia in his brand new £700,000 Rolls-Royce for a 20-minute private shopping trip, for which the shutters remained down. Rashford, who wore a green tracksuit with white trainers, was also seen signing autographs for fans. One young supporter was even wearing a number 10 Man United shirt with the England striker's name on the back, and received a signature from his hero. It came after United's international players were pictured back in training for the first time, as they gear up for a pre-season tour of America. Marcus Rashford parked on double yellow lines in Cheshire on Saturday as he visited a jewellers He was joined by Man United teammate Tyrell Malacia in his £700,000 Rolls-Royce The 25-year-old striker signed an autograph for a young fan donning a Man United shirt The likes of Bruno Fernandes, Casemiro and Rashford were all pictured heading into Carrington on Saturday, and the squad seemed in a buoyant mood as they began to dust off the cobwebs ahead of next season. Those who did not take part in the post-season internationals have been back in training for over a week now, with their first game held last week as they beat Leeds 2-0 in Norway in their opening game of the summer. Non-internationals such as Mason Mount , Raphael Varane and Tom Heaton played in the game which saw youngsters Noam Emeran and Joe Hugill net in the second half to give Erik ten Hag's side the win. They will continue their campaign against Lyon on Wednesday before heading to the United States for games against Arsenal, Wrexham, Real Madrid and Borussia Dortmund. Rashford's last football came just over a month ago, when he played half an hour in England's 4-0 win over Malta and just under an hour of the 7-0 victory over North Macedonia, scoring on the stroke of half time. The England forward was seen smiling jubilantly on his return to training with fellow Red Devils attacker Anthony Elanga, who will be hoping to kick on next season and earn more first team opportunities. Rashford enjoyed the best goal soring season of his career in 2022-23, bagging 30 across all competitions as United came third in the league and one the League Cup. It came after Rashford returned to Carrington on Saturday as Manchester United geared up for the new season The striker painted a happy figure as he linked back up with the United squad Rashford was a key player for Erik ten Hag's side last season, scoring 30 goals as they won the League Cup and came third in the league He excelled on the left wing, but Erik ten Hag's failure to bring in a new striker could force him back into the middle again next season. The Red Devils were keen on Atalanta's Rasmus Hojlund but have been stunned by his £68 million price tag , while fellow targets Harry Kane and Victor Osimhen would have been even more expensive. If he does want to keen Rashford on the left, Ten Hag's only obvious option through the middle is the injury-prone Anthony Martial, although he did experiment with Jadon Sancho as a false nine in a recent friendly. United will still be hoping to find a new striker before their first Premier League game of the season against Wolves n August 14. newsArray.title: Transfer news LIVE: Onana 'travelling' for Man Utd medical, secret Klopp meeting, Kane twist
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Colin Millar)
newsArray.description: Arsenal fans can finally laud the signing of Declan Rice for a British record transfer fee of £105million, with West Ham set to use the funds to move for Harry Maguire
newsArray.content: The start of the Premier League campaign is now just one month away but there is still plenty of movement to come in the summer transfer window. On Saturday, Arsenal finally confirmed the signing of Declan Rice from West Ham for a new club record £105million fee. That followed c ompleting a deal for Ajax defender Jurrien Timber for £38.5 million, with Mikel Arteta's summer spending now beyond £200million. Manchester United are still pushing to sign Inter goalkeeper Andre Onana, and are also chasing Japanese stopper Zion Suzuki following the departure of David de Gea. Their search for a striker is proving tough however, with Atalanta's valuation of Rasmus Hojlund. Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson is still weighing up his future amid a huge offer to join the Saudi Pro League, with Fabinho also on the brink of a move to the Middle East. As a result, the Reds are set to move for Southampton star Romeo Lavia, whilst Chelsea are the front runners to sign Moises Caicedo from Brighton. Stay tuned for all the latest transfer news and gossip throughout the day... 13:51 KEY EVENT Done deal: Xavi Simons to rejoin PSG Xavi Simons is set to rejoin Paris Saint-Germain after a starring campaign at PSV Eindhoven, where he bagged 22 goals. 13:31 KEY EVENT Onana 'flying to England' to finalise Man Utd transfer Andre Onana is set to travel to England to complete his transfer to Manchester United after receiving a phone call from Erik ten Hag. Onana is set to sign a five-year contract after receiving assurances from Ten Hag that the deal was on track to being completed. It is believed a deal close to €50million (£43m), which includes around £5m in add-ons, is set to be agreed. The Dutch boss had always prioritised the signing of a new number one at Old Trafford this summer and the confirmation that David de Gea has left the club ensures that for the first time in 12 years, United will be lining up with a new first-choice goalkeeper next month. Read about Onana’s move to Man Utd 13:08 Liam Prenderville Spurs keen on Vlahovic Tottenham could move for Juventus striker Dusan Vlahovic if Harry Kane leaves the club. Kane continues to be linked with Bayern Munich while PSG are now also thought to be keen on the England skipper. The Mail reports Spurs have sounded out Vlahovic over a potential move to north London, and believe he would be an ideal replacement for Kane. 12:54 Fraser Watson West Ham chase Leicester star Harvey Barnes West Ham are interested in signing Leicester City forward Harvey Barnes, Sky Sports News is reporting. Newcastle United are also interested, but neither club have submitted a formal bid. Harvey Barnes ( Image: Getty Images ) 12:25 Fraser Watson Messi sells out Inter Miami stadium Lionel Messi will officially be unveiled as an Inter Miami player at the DRV PNK Stadium today. And tickets have sold out at the 18,000 seater arena as excitement hits fever pitch. 12:09 KEY EVENT Chelsea negotiate Caicedo fee Chelsea and Brighton are negotiating a fee for Moises Caicedo, according to Dello Sport . Brighton want a deal worth up to £100 million, with an initial £80 million and a potential £20 million in add ons. Chelsea however, do not want to exceed £90 million. 12:02 Fraser Watson PSG reject ex-Chelsea star Agent Jorge Mendes has offered Joao Felix to PSG, according to L'Equipe . However, the French club is focused on other business and have rejected the Portuguese star, who was on loan at Chelsea last season. 11:29 Fraser Watson Luton star Adebayo signs contract extension Luton Town forward Elijah Adebayo has signed a contract extension at the club. He scored 10 times for the Hatters last season, and told the club website: "It's wonderful to sign any contract but especially here. Because since I've come in, I've enjoyed my time here. There's a unique set of lads in the changing room." 11:01 Fraser Watson Mahrez agrees terms for Middle East move Riyad Mahrez has verbally agreed terms with Al-Ahli, according to reports. The deal is not completed but the Algerian international wants the move. The two clubs are yet to discuss a fee though. 10:32 Fraser Watson PSG to let Neymar leave PSG want to sell Neymar this summer, according to RMC Sport . However, they are not prepared to also los Kylian Mbappe. They still want to keeo the French star provided he opens talks on a contract extension. 10:03 Fraser Watson Liverpool legend sticks up for Henderson Ex-Liverpool striker Robbie Fowler has defended Jordan Henderson amid reports he's moving to play in Saudi Arabia. "I’m not going to condemn Jordan , Steven Gerrard or anyone else who has gone to work in Saudi Arabia , or is thinking of doing so," he wrote in his Mirror Football column. "Not because I’m taking the money too - that’s simply not true. As I’ve explained before, I have taken a job in the league below the Saudi Pro League because I am ambitious to become a manager, because I want to prove myself." Read the full column here 09:30 Fraser Watson Onana deal could be done today A deal to take Andre Onana from Inter Milan to Old Trafford could be completed today, accoring to alfredopedulla . The two clubs are still negotiating the exact nature of the fee, but Inter have now accepted Onana will leave and want to close the deal as soon as possible. The Cameroon keeper himself is waiting for the green light to fly to England. 09:02 Fraser Watson David de Gea heading back to Spain David de Gea could be heading back to Spain. Fichajes reports the former United keeper is being chased by Sevilla, amid speculation over their No 1 Yassine Bounou. He has been linked with both Paris Saint-Germain. 08:39 Fraser Watson Juventus after Barca star Kessie A new round of talks hasve been scheduled by Juventus in their bid to sign Franck Kessie from Barcelona, according to reports in Italy. The Serie A giants are keen on a deal, but Kessie is said to favour a move to the Premier League if he leaves the Nou Camp. MADRID, SPAIN - MARCH 02: Franck Kessie of FC Barcelona reacts during Semi Final Leg One - Copa Del Rey match between Real Madrid CF and FC Barcelona at Estadio Santiago Bernabeu on March 02, 2023 in Madrid, Spain. (Photo by Diego Souto/Quality Sport Images/Getty Images) ( Image: Diego Souto/Quality Sport Images/Getty Images) 08:24 Fraser Watson ICYMI: Rice vows to improve under Arteta Declan Rice has promised Arsenal fans he will get better after his move to the Emirates. On working with Mikel Arteta, he said: “I know he’s going to get the best out of me. I know I’ve got more levels to go up in my game, and I feel like he’s the manager to take me to those next levels. I’m really excited to be working with him.” 08:09 Fraser Watson West Ham set to move for Maguire West Ham are set to launch a move for Manchester United outcast Harry Maguire after selling captain Declan Rice to Arsenal . The Hammers are ready to take advantage of United's desire to move Maguire on, with the Daily Telegraph reporting they will target him as their next signing. 07:36 Fraser Watson Mane future in doubt after Tuchel blast Saido Mane's future at Bayern Munich appears up in the air after words from boss Thomas Tuchel. "He fell short of expectations," he told reporters. "The competitive situation is extremely high, the starting position is not easy for him. The player knows that too, he knows my opinion and the opinion of the club." 07:14 Fraser Watson Bayern Munich chief's Harry Kane claim Harry Kane is ready to leave Tottenham , according to Bayern Munich's honourary president has claimed. "So far, Harry has made it very clear in all talks that his decision is there. And if it stays, then we'll get him," said Uli Hoeness. "He now has another opportunity to come to a top club in Europe." Read the full story here. 06:18 Fraser Watson ICYMI: Declan Rice breaks British transfer record It was West Ham, not Arsenal, who announced Declan Rice had left the club on Saturday morning for a British transfer record of £105 million. He's since addressed West Ham fans, and lauded Mikel Arteta as the manager to take him "to the next level." Read the full story here. 06:10 KEY EVENT Lionel Messi completes move to Inter Miami A huge moment overnight for Lionel Messi, and football in America. 05:55 Fraser Watson Good morning Welcome back as we bring you all the latest transfer news! 23:05 Tom Blow Goodnight! That's all we've got time for this evening! Please join us again on Sunday morning for more transfer news and gossip. 22:36 Tom Hopkinson Sheff Utd want Shelvey Sheffield United are considering a move for out-of-favour Nottingham Forest midfielder Jonjo Shelvey. The former Liverpool and Newcastle player only moved to the City Ground six months ago but he has been left out of the club’s pre-season trining camp and Steve Cooper is now willing to let him leave. Shelvey wasn’t named in Forest’s last seven squads of last season after reacting angrily to being named on the bench against Liverpool. And the Blades are exploring the ex-England international’s availability as they look to strengthen their squad following their return to the Premier League. Boss Paul Heckingbottom is working to a tight budget and Shelvey would not break the bank. But he also has vast experience of the top flight and would undoubtedly strengthen the Brammall Lane squad. ( Image: PA) 22:00 Jacob Leeks Wright's role in Rice transfer Arsenal legend Ian Wright has joked he played a key role in convincing Declan Rice to join the Gunners. Rice completed a £105million transfer to the Gunners on Saturday, bringing an end to a long-running saga. At one point in the summer, it looked as if Manchester City had pulled into pole position in the race to sign the England international. But Arsenal were able to fight off that interest from their Premier League title rivals and secure Mikel Arteta's top target. And it turns out that Wright, who won the top-flight with the Gunners, played an important role in turning Rice's head towards Arteta's side. Click here to read more... 21:23 Colin Millar De Jong swap deal Barcelona have reactivated their interest in signing Bernardo Silva – with speculative suggestions that Frenkie de Jong may be offered to Pep Guardiola’s side to help facilitate the deal. Portugal international Silva has been on Barca’s wanted list for over a year with boss Xavi Hernandez confirming they wanted a deal last summer, which did not come to fruition. Silva has since become a key transfer target for PSG, who are looking for a player of that profile to replace Lionel Messi. City boss Guardiola has repeatedly refused to sanction Silva’s exit despite the player’s keenness for pastures new. The playmaker played a pivotal role in the club’s successes last campaign but he has made no secret internally that he was open to a move away from the Etihad. Click here to read more... 20:44 KEY EVENT Ramsey's new club Aaron Ramsey has signed a two-year contract with Cardiff City. The Wales captain, 32, joins the Championship club after leaving Nice. ( Image: PA) 20:19 Kieran King Bayern after Alvarez Bayern Munich are eyeing up a move for Manchester City forward Julian Alvarez as an alternative if they fail to sign Tottenham's Harry Kane this summer. Kane is Bayern's priority transfer target but there is a growing feeling that the England international could stay at Spurs beyond the end of the window. Bayern chief executive Jan-Christian Dreesen met with Daniel Levy for breakfast in London on Thursday as Kane's future was once again put into question. Click here to read more... 20:18 Tom Blow Arsenal ignore Rice concerns Manchester United decided against bidding for Declan Rice two years ago because their recruitment team weren't convinced by him. Arsenal completed the signing of Rice, 24, from West Ham in a £105million deal on Saturday afternoon. The Englishman has become the most expensive British footballer of all time and has signed a five-year deal with the Gunners, with the option of a further year. Rice became a transfer target for United when Ole Gunnar Solskjaer was in charge. It's believed the Norwegian, who has since been succeeded by Erik ten Hag, was interested in signing Rice after he helped England reach the final of Euro 2020 in July 2021. Click here to read more... 19:22 Tom Blow Messi joins Inter Miami Lionel Messi has officially joined Inter Miami... 18:54 Tom Blow Wolves after Scott Wolves will make a bid in excess of £20million for Bristol City midfielder Alex Scott, according to The Athletic . Scott, 19, has already played 83 Championship games for Bristol City. He was recently named as the Championship's Young Player of the Season.

newsArray.title: Sunday sport: Kerry and Derry to face off in All-Ireland semi-final
creator: BreakingNews.ie
newsArray.description: Kerry are defending the Sam Maguire Cup, while Derry are attempting to reach their first final in 30 years
newsArray.content: GAA Kerry and Derry meet in the second All Ireland senior football championship semi-final today. Throw in at Croke Park is at 4pm. Kerry are defending the Sam Maguire Cup, while Derry are attempting to reach their first final in 30 years. Dublin await the winners in the decider. Advertisement They finally pulled away from Monaghan to win by seven points yesterday. The curtain raiser at Croke Park today is the Junior All-Ireland final between New York and Kilkenny. It begins at 1.30pm. The ladies footballers of Donegal and Dublin contest the concluding All Ireland quarter-final this afternoon. There is a 2pm start time in Ballybofey. Mayo, Cork and Kerry are already in the last four, with Meath having lost their All Ireland title following a four-point defeat to Kerry yesterday. Advertisement Golf Rory McIlroy has work to do to win the Scottish Open at the Renaissance Club. He is 1 over par for his final round through 12 holes and 12 under for the tournament. McIlroy is two shots behind leader Robert MacIntyre of Scotland. Advertisement He is 6 under for his round with three holes to play and 14 under overall. Shane Lowry is in a tie for 11th place on 8 under par. Tom McKibbin is 4 under par and Padraig Harrington is 3 under. Tennis Serbia's Novak Djokovic and Spain's Carlos Alcaraz go head-to-head in the Wimbledon men's singles final in London this afternoon. Djokovic is attempting to win his 8th crown at the All England Club - while top seed Alcaraz is bidding for his first major on grass, 2pm is the start time. If Djokovic wins it will be 24 Grand Slam career titles. X

newsArray.title: Chelsea still in the race for Liverpool transfer target as they also make progress on another deal
creator: Mark Brus
newsArray.description: Chelsea are reportedly getting closer to an agreement on the transfer of Brighton midfielder Moises Caicedo whilst also still being in the race for Southampton wonderkid Romeo Lavia.The Blues will no doubt hope to strengthen in midfield this summer after losing both N’Golo Kante and Mateo Kovacic, while Jorginho was another key figure to leave […] The post Chelsea still in the race for Liverpool transfer target as they also make progress on another deal appeared first on CaughtOffside.
newsArray.content: The Blues will no doubt hope to strengthen in midfield this summer after losing both N’Golo Kante and Mateo Kovacic, while Jorginho was another key figure to leave the club back in January. Caicedo seems to be the priority but Fabrizio Romano has made it clear in his video below that Chelsea are also still there for Lavia, alongside Liverpool, while Arsenal could also be one to watch for the Belgian starlet in case they manage to sell Thomas Partey to a club from Saudi Arabia… Caicedo looks ideal for CFC, but if they could land Lavia as well, that would be another significant investment that could give the club some of the finest young midfielders in world football after they already brought in Enzo Fernandez back in January. Liverpool, however, will also surely want to ensure they can win the race for a talent like Lavia, whose presence could be crucial if the Reds end up losing the likes of Jordan Henderson and Fabinho this summer.

newsArray.title: Andre Onana 'flying to England' to finalise Man Utd transfer after Erik ten Hag call
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Colin Millar)
newsArray.description: Manchester United are close to completing the deal to sign goalkeeper Andre Onana from Inter as they make their second signing of the summer after Mason Mount's transfer
newsArray.content: Andre Onana is set to travel to England to complete his transfer to Manchester United after receiving a phone call from Erik ten Hag. Onana is set to sign a five-year contract after receiving assurances from Ten Hag that the deal was on track to being completed. It is believed a deal close to €50million (£43m), which includes around £5m in add-ons, is set to be agreed. The Dutch boss had always prioritised the signing of a new number one at Old Trafford this summer and the confirmation that David de Gea has left the club ensures that for the first time in 12 years, United will be lining up with a new first-choice goalkeeper next month. Erik ten Hag handed goalkeeper dilemma as Man Utd warned club "cannot wait forever" Harry Kane's Man Utd preference, secret transfer meeting and PSG hijack attempt Onana has already explained the specifics of his style of play that will benefit United, which will allow United to play with a higher back-line and to dominate more territory, while their possession should also increase as the Cameroonian is comfortable with playing out from the back. Sport Witness have cited reports in the Italian press from Gazzetta dello Sport and Corriere dello Sport claiming that Onana was given reassurances from Ten Hag that a deal was on track with the two clubs continuing to negotiate the finer details to clinch the move. It adds that the former Ajax star is planning to travel to Manchester on Sunday or Monday to undergo medical tests and seal the move. That would allow him to fly out with United on their pre-season tour, which starts next week. Ten Hag and Onana worked together for five years at Ajax ( Image: ISABELLA BONOTTO/AFP via Getty Images) Have Your Say! Will Onana prove to be a transformative signing for Man Utd ? Tell us what you think here. Negotiations had dragged on with the two clubs thought to be moderate valuations apart in the move, with both now set to cede some ground in order to process the deal. Inter are equally keen to complete the deal promptly to allow them to invest in other targets. Ten Hag has driven United’s transfer pursuit of Onana, over that of Porto shot-stopper Diogo Costa or David Raya of Brentford. He is aware of his strengths and weaknesses but is convinced the Inter goalkeeper is his man at Old Trafford. United completing the signing of Onana will allow them to move onto other targets, most notably Atalanta striker Rasmus Hojlund. It will also speed up the expected departure of Dean Henderson, who Nottingham Forest want to sign on a permanent deal with a possible fee of £30million.

newsArray.title: New Tiger in town for Open as Christensen qualifies in Woods’ absence
newsArray.description: Christensen was the only amateur to make it through final qualifying across four venues.
newsArray.content: Tiger Christensen came through final qualifying at West Lancashire Golf Club in Crosby, near Liverpool, earlier this month to book his major debut. But the United States-based 19-year-old accepts the similarities end with sharing the same name, country of residence and preference for an orange-and-black striped animal driver headcover. 🇩🇪Tiger Christensen (5/5) — The Open (@TheOpen) “He’s a pretty big inspiration. To me he’s the greatest of all time,” said the Arizona University student “I think it’s really special what he’s done for the game, changed the entire game and made it more popular, and his achievements are just unbelievable. “It’s something you could look up to.” Referring to how he got his name he added: “It’s not only named after Tiger Woods – my dad has a very good friend who’s a retired boxer and his ring name was Tiger so it’s 50/50.” “For me it’s never been (a burden) because it’s just my birth name. I’m glad to be called Tiger. “I understand everything I’m ever going to do they are going to compare me to him straightaway but at the end of the day it’s a different time, I don’t have any connection to him. It’s just a name.” “I played a lot of football when I was younger and I always wanted to be a football pro until I was about 10 and then I started playing US kids tournaments and that is when I transitioned to wanting to become a golf professional,” added the Hamburg-born golfer, whose world ranking is above 3,700. Christensen was the only amateur to make it through final qualifying across four venues, only three days after almost securing a place via the European Amateur Championship in Estonia. A month earlier the teenager made his DP World Tour debut with an appearance in the Porsche European Open held in the city of his birth, although rounds of 80 and 79 saw him miss the cut by some distance on 13 over. “I cope with pressure pretty good, although at the DP World Tour event there was a new pressure I hadn’t had in playing with spectators,” he said of his imminent Open appearance. “Usually in amateur events only the final couple of groups, if you are playing well, get spectators but I think the DP World Tour event really helped me going into the Open. Tiger Watch 🐅👀 Young German Amateur Tiger Christensen is tied for 4th after a 68 this morning. Live Scoring ⬇️ — West Lancs Golf Club (@WestLancsGC) “I’ve now had those couple of crowd experiences, the seriousness of everyone around the tournament and how professional it is, so I think that will help me a lot. “I don’t want to sound cocky but I was pretty certain of qualifying. I played the US Open qualifying and fell just short. I felt it wasn’t far away. “It’s going to be a great experience. I’m going to go with zero expectations and take it all in. “But my final goal, which is supported by smaller goals, is to win as many majors as I can.”

newsArray.title: OM : la patte Marcelino jugée par les Nîmois
newsArray.description: L'entraîneur de Nîmes, Frédéric Bompard, est revenu sur le match face à l’OM. Il a décrit son adversaire du jour, Marcelino.
newsArray.content: Hier soir, l’OM s’est imposé face au Nîmes Olympique grâce à un doublé de Vitinha pour le premier match de la pré-saison. La première de Marcelino en tant qu’entraîneur olympien est réussite et beaucoup de Marseillais ont eu du temps de jeu. L’adversaire du jour a pu commenter son nouveau style de jeu imposé par le coach espagnol. Après la rencontre, Frédéric Bompard, anciennement adjoint à l’OM et aujourd’hui coach à Nîmes s’est entretenu avec La Provence pour parler de la mise en place de Marcelino. « Le jeu est différent de celui de la saison dernière. L'an dernier, ça pressait très haut. Même s'ils sont quand même allés nous chercher, ils sont venus nous presser. Certains joueurs ont encore ce genre d'automatismes », a d’abord commenté l’entraîneur de l’équipe de National. « Il y a peut-être un peu moins de jeu vers l'avant, beaucoup plus de jeu entre les lignes. On est plus dans le “tiki taka“ que ça ne l'était la saison dernière. Avec Tudor, c'était beaucoup plus du jeu vers l'avant à la récupération, du football direct. C'est ce qui change un peu. Après, ça reste qu'un match, il va falloir attendre encore un peu », a-t-il reconnu pour le quotidien régional. Frédéric Bompard a ensuite été interrogé sur le système utilisé par Marcelino. « Ce n’est n'est pas le même. L'année dernière, ça jouait à trois, là c'est à quatre. Hier, ils ont joué en 4-2-3-1, ils ont changé les joueurs à la mi-temps, comme nous d'ailleurs. Ce ne sera pas du tout le même OM que celui de la saison dernière, ça c'est sûr. J'ai bien aimé mon échange avec Marcelino, j'aime bien le personnage, le fait de discuter comme ça, ça m'a bien plu », a conclu l’entraîneur des crocos. Le piqué de @9Vitinha lors de #OMNO 🇵🇹💫 🎥 Le 𝗿𝗲́𝘀𝘂𝗺𝗲́ 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲𝘁 👉 https://t.co/RPPqQrGEyU pic.twitter.com/OyGLa5alan L'entraîneur de Nîmes, Frédéric Bompard, est revenu sur le match face à l’OM. Il a décrit son adversaire du jour, Marcelino. "J'ai bien aimé mon échange avec Marcelino, j'aime bien le personnage, le fait de discuter comme ça, ça m'a bien plu".

newsArray.title: ‘Harry Kane has clearly signalled to join Bayern Munich,’ says Hoeness
newsArray.description: The German champion is said to be intent on securing the signing of England’s record scorer, whose contract with Spurs runs out in 2024.
newsArray.content: Bayern Munich’s honorary president Uli Hoeness has expressed confidence that England captain Harry Kane will join the German giants from Tottenham Hotspur. Kane “has clearly signalled in all conversations that his decision (to join Bayern this summer) has been taken and if he sticks to that, then we’ll get him because Tottenham will have to give way”, Hoeness said. It has been reported that Bayern has agreed on personal terms with Kane, but an initial 70-million-euro ($76-million) bid was rejected by Spurs who are said to be demanding at least 100 million euros to part with their talismanic striker who has been included in the London club’s squad for their pre-season Asia-Pacific tour. The German champion is said to be intent on securing the signing of England’s record scorer, whose contract with Spurs runs out in 2024. Kane’s camp is believed to have approved the move, but Bayern needs an agreement on a transfer fee with Tottenham to seal the transfer. Hoeness said Kane “wants to play in an international competition and Tottenham are not qualified next season” for Europe “unlike our club”. The striker “now has the chance to come play for one of the best clubs in Europe”, added Hoeness, a member of a Bayern committee overseeing this summer’s recruitment alongside Karl-Heinz Rummenigge, Jan-Christian Dreesen and coach Thomas Tuchel. Hoeness admitted that negotiating with Spurs president Daniel Levy was not easy. Levy, he said, is “intelligent and we first have to get him to a stage where he will figure out an amount” for the transfer. “He is trying to buy time, he is a seasoned professional, I appreciate him a lot. But on the other hand, we weren’t born yesterday.” Comments Related stories Related Topics

newsArray.title: Arsene Wenger insists Arsenal's £105m outlay on Declan Rice is a 'good investment'
newsArray.description: Building a squad with a focus on youth was a hallmark of Wenger's 22-year stint at the Gunners, and he hailed the arrival of Rice at the club as a continuation of that philosophy.
newsArray.content: Arsene Wenger insists Arsenal's £105m outlay on Declan Rice is a 'good investment' as the Gunners legend laments that he 'had to cope with no money at all' during his time in charge Arsenal legend Arsene Wenger hailed the club's signing of Declan Rice Former West Ham star was unveiled as the club's record signing on Saturday Wenger reflected such funds were not available towards the end of his tenure By Adrian Bishop For Mailonline Updated: 14:08, 16 July 2023 e-mail View comments Arsene Wenger has revealed that he sees Arsenal 's club-record signing of Declan Rice as a good investment in the squads future. Following weeks of speculation, the former West Ham captain's move to the Emirates was finally confirmed on Saturday, with the £105m fee eclipsing the £100m Man City paid for Jack Grealish to make Rice the most expensive British footballer ever. After coming agonisingly close to a first Premier League title in nearly two decades last season, Mikel Arteta has been afforded a sizeable war chest to continue his side's progress in 2023-24. Along with the capture Rice, Arsenal have also signed Kai Havertz from Chelsea for £65m and Jurrien Timber from Ajax for £40m, with further additions expected before the end of the transfer window. Building a squad with a focus on youth was a hallmark of Wenger's 22-year stint at the Gunners, and he hailed the arrival of Rice at the club as a continuation of that philosophy. Arsene Wenger hailed Arsenal's club-record £105m signing of Declan Rice from West Ham The legendary Gunners boss called the move a 'good investment' and tipped the squad to win the Premier League 'I think it is a good investment,' Wenger told Eurosport . 'Overall, personally I think they have made good buys as they are players who are now mature, 23,24, and still young so can stay together for a few years. 'They will be under more pressure after last year, but they have learned a lot and they can show they can deal with that pressure now.' The signings of Rice, Timber and Havertz already rank among the ten highest transfer fees paid in the club's history, with a further four players on the list having signed with the club in the five years since Wegner's departure in 2018. Reflecting on the funds available to him towards the end of his time in charge, the 73-year-old admitted that he was forced to develop his squad utilising a different approach. Arsenal's last Premier League win came nearly two decades ago with Wenger at the helm 'I had to cope with no money at all, so you have to find a different way. 'Arsenal is now in a good financial situation and bought what they think will win the championship.' Arsenal's last Premier League triumph came during Wenger's tenure at the club and the Frenchman backed his former side to finally reclaim the title next season. 'I believe we will win the championship, it is as simple as that.' newsArray.title: Manchester City youngster Josh Adam is attracting interest from Lille and Club Brugge
newsArray.description: Josh Adam could become one of the next academy products to leave Manchester City with interest in him growing from clubs in France and Belgium.
newsArray.content: Manchester City youngster Josh Adam is attracting interest from Lille and Club Brugge, as Pep Guardiola's side continue to cash in on there lucrative academy Man City midfielder Josh Adam is attracting interest from France and Europe The 19-year-old will struggle to secure first team football if he stays at the Etihad Pep Guardiola's side made £50m from selling academy products last summer By Adrian Kajumba For Mailonline Updated: 08:33 EDT, 16 July 2023 e-mail View comments Josh Adam could become one of the next academy products to leave Manchester City with interest in him growing from clubs in France and Belgium. Lorient, who tried to sign attacking midfielder Adam in January, Lille and Club Brugge are all keen on signing the 19 year-old this summer. Scotland under-21 international Adam joined City from Celtic three years ago and is tipped for a bright future for club and country after impressing across Europe at youth level. However, with a congested pathway to first-team football at City Adam could move on in search of more opportunities. City’s youth team products have become an increasingly lucrative revenue stream for the club in more recent years. Man City midfielder Josh Adam is attracting interest from clubs in Belgium and France Last summer Gavin Bazunu, Aro Muric, Juan Larios, Romeo Lavia, Darko Gyabi and Sam Edozie all left City for a combined sum in excess of £50m. This week Southampton sealed the £15m signing of City midfield prospect Shea Charles, and goalkeeper James Trafford is set to join Burnley in a £19m deal after inspiring England’s under-21s to Euros glory. Pep Guardiola's side have also strengthened their side this summer, with Mateo Kovacic arriving from Chelsea for £25 million. They have lost Ilkay Gundogan to Barcelona on a free transfer, though, and doubts remain over Riyad Mahrez's future amid links with Saudi Arabia. City's title defence will get underway in just under a month's time, when they face club legend Vincent Kompany's Burnley side in August 11. Pep Guardiola's side made £50 million from selling academy products last season Share or comment on this article: Manchester City youngster Josh Adam is attracting interest from Lille and Club Brugge e-mail Add comment Comments 0 Share what you think No comments have so far been submitted.
